      Constructs and executes a prepared Insert sql query as a middle-man translator between instances of the Customer data structure and the SQL database being added to
      static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> customerPopulation()
      Returns the ObservableList containing all existing instances of Customer
      boolean deleteAssociatedAppointments​(Appointment appointment)
      Removes the passed instance of Appointment from an ObservableList of appointments associated with a specific instance of Customer and returns a boolean value of true if it has successfully been removed
      static boolean deleteCustomer​(Customer selectedCustomer)
      Removes the selectedCustomer value from the ObservableList of existing values and removes its CustomerID integer value from the pool of CustomerID values in-use so that it may be freely reassigned if need be, maintaining parity with the SQL database's Primary Key column.
      static boolean deleteCustomerFromDatabase​(Customer givenCustomer)
      Deletes the row entry in the SQL database customers table that matches the passed Customer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer​(int CustomerID,
                java.lang.String CustomerName,
                java.lang.String CustomerPhone,
                java.lang.String CustomerCountry,
                java.lang.String CustomerPostal,
                java.lang.String CustomerState,
                java.lang.String CustomerAddress)
        Customer data structure
        Parameters:
        CustomerID - The Customer's ID, unique as used to reference to specific instances of Customer
        CustomerName - The Customer's name string
        CustomerPhone - The Customer's phone string
        CustomerCountry - The Customer's country string
        CustomerPostal - The Customer's postal or zip code string
        CustomerState - The Customer's first-level division, i.e. State or Province, string
        CustomerAddress - The Customer's address string

      • addAssociatedAppointment

        public void addAssociatedAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
        Adds the passed instance of Appointment into an ObservableList of appointments associated with a specific instance of Customer
        Parameters:
        appointment - the Appointment to be added to the ObservableList

      • deleteAssociatedAppointments

        public boolean deleteAssociatedAppointments​(Appointment appointment)
        Removes the passed instance of Appointment from an ObservableList of appointments associated with a specific instance of Customer and returns a boolean value of true if it has successfully been removed
        Parameters:
        appointment - the Appointment to be removed from the ObservableList
        Returns:
        boolean indication if the removal operation has successfully been carried out

      • getAssociatedAppointments

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAssociatedAppointments()
        Returns the private ObservableList associatedAppointments which contains all appointments associated with a specific instance of Customer
        Returns:
        the private ObservableList associatedAppointments

      • uniqueCustomerID

        public static int uniqueCustomerID()
        Manages the list of integer values already in-use with an instance of Customer and returns an as yet unused integer and adds that provided integer to the Vector of ID integers in use
        Returns:
        an integer that has not already been used with any other instance of Customer

      • addCustomerToDatabase

        public static boolean addCustomerToDatabase​(Customer givenCustomer)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Constructs and executes a prepared Insert sql query as a middle-man translator between instances of the Customer data structure and the SQL database being added to
        Parameters:
        givenCustomer - the provided instance of Customer whose values are to be entered into the SQL database
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating a successful sql insertion
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown in case of SQL database issues

      • modifyCustomerInDatabase

        public static boolean modifyCustomerInDatabase​(Customer givenCustomer)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Makes changes to the SQL database entry that matches the passed Customer
        Parameters:
        givenCustomer - The changed Customer to overwrite the existing entry within the SQL database
        Returns:
        a boolean indication if the SQL database entry was successfully updated
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown in case of SQL database issues

      • deleteCustomerFromDatabase

        public static boolean deleteCustomerFromDatabase​(Customer givenCustomer)
        Deletes the row entry in the SQL database customers table that matches the passed Customer
        Parameters:
        givenCustomer - The selected Customer to have its existing entry within the SQL database be deleted
        Returns:
        a boolean indication if the SQL database entry was successfully deleted

      • addCustomer

        public static void addCustomer​(Customer newCustomer)
        Adds the passed instance of Customer to the ObservableList allCustomers
        Parameters:
        newCustomer - the Customer to be added to the ObservableList

      • updateCustomer

        public static void updateCustomer​(int index,
                                  Customer selectedCustomer)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Makes changes to the ObservableList entry that matches the passed Customer's index location
        Parameters:
        index - the location within the ObservableList that is to have its value overwritten
        selectedCustomer - the new Customer value that will overwrite the existing ObservableList value
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown in case of SQL database issues

      • deleteCustomer

        public static boolean deleteCustomer​(Customer selectedCustomer)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Removes the selectedCustomer value from the ObservableList of existing values and removes its CustomerID integer value from the pool of CustomerID values in-use so that it may be freely reassigned if need be, maintaining parity with the SQL database's Primary Key column.
        Parameters:
        selectedCustomer - the Customer value that will be removed from the ObservableList
        Returns:
        a boolean indication if the Appointment was successfully removed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown in case of SQL database issues
